alert.note: Alert for San Benito; Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 8:03PM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Water levels are starting to go down, but small stream flooding continues and the gauge remains at moderate flood stage. * WHERE...Pacheco Creek near Dunneville including the surrounding areas of southern Santa Clara County and northern San Benito County near that gauge. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take a few hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 803 PM PST, Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern San Benito and Southeastern Santa Clara Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
